Package edu.missouri.phys

Class RouteHead

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mmkrusniak.phys.Route
      • com.mmkrusniak.phys.RouteHead
  • public class RouteHead
extends Route
    RouteHead is a drone instruction which requests only a heading change. At the moment we do not account for drones' rotational velocity and acceleration - we assume that heading changes are instantaneous. These types of "heading" routes are therefore assumed not to have any sort of target position; they complete immediately.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RouteHead​(double heading)
      Constructs a route that turns the drone to face a certain heading.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RouteHead

        public RouteHead​(double heading)
        Constructs a route that turns the drone to face a certain heading.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getTarget

        public Point getTarget()
        Gives the target location of the route. Heading routes are untargeted (they take a single step to complete, and are considered "done" at any location), so this always returns null.
        Specified by:
        getTarget in class Route
        Returns:
        null.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget​(Point target)
        Sets the target location of the route. Heading routes are untargeted (they take a single step to complete, * and are considered "done" at any location), so this has no effect.
        Specified by:
        setTarget in class Route
        Parameters:
        target - Not used.

      • apply

        public void apply​(MotionState state,
                  double t)
        Applies the route onto a drone's motion. For a RouteHead this amounts to simply setting the drone's heading to the one specified.
        Specified by:
        apply in class Route
        Parameters:
        state - A drone's motion state.
        t - The amount of time over which to apply the route.
